reviewText: It's a pretty simple game, just jump and shoot.  The gameplay is fine, I guess, but there's not really anything to keep me playing it.  There's no replay value, the computer players don't seem to show up when I try to do singleplayer vs computer.  It's just me against a bunch of enemies and there doesn't seem to be a way to win.  The main thing that annoyed me about this game is that upon installing it and attempting to play, you will receive an error saying that steam cannot find the executable file for this game.  somebody was nice enough to post a solution on the forums: http://steamcommunity.com/app/438030/discussions/0/405691147594349721/\nSo you have to rename the .exe based on whether you are playing it on mac or pc.  The fact that the game didn't even work on first startup was the main issue for me.  Having to jump through hoops just to get a game to work is not my idea of a pleasant experience.  If this issue gets fixed in the future, then I guess you can ignore this technical issue, but at the time of reviewing, it is unacceptable.

Ooh boy!  This game is a wonderful trainwreck.  It's too boring to talk about the substance of the game, but I want to focus on how it presents itself.

Before you buy the game, it's prudent to point out that, despite the game being Windows-only, the trailer was recorded on Mac OS.

reviewText:
Very simple and funny game, but it feels empty and no reason to keep playing.
PROS :
Good pixel graphics.
Easy gameplay.
Different characters.
Trading cards !
2 game modes : singleplayer (vs AI) and local co-op (between friends)
Very cheap.

CONS :
Need more weapons and larger maps.
Need online mode.
Need an EXIT button.
Need an options menu (full-screen or windowed, remap the controls...)
Those 5 weapons are a little buggy.
Level editor would be great, specially with this game.
The music don't fit with this game (brostep...really ?)
Try adding some achievements (not farming type achievements)

I'll update my review if the developer add or change some features.

reviewText:
What to say,this is a great tribute to super crate box,but with local multiplayer!

Gameplay Gameplay is like playing the super crate box,you will use arrows to walk and another key to shot,in the case of player 1 is the key K,and a key to special too.game has 4 modes to play,5 stages,15 levels, and 10 characters,so you will have much thing to do in this game.the most cool feature of it is the multiplayer,where you can grab a real friend(real people,not steam friend) and kill some enemies.
Your bullets is limited,so take care about it and don't forget to pick new weapons to kill every enemy.
But the single player mode rocks too!

Soundtrack Music is very well,but start on the max volume,so if you don't want just configue it.

Positive Points + Cheap
+Variety of stages,levels,and characters
+Local Multiplayer and singleplayer
+ Good Music

Negative Points - Just online multiplayer.

OverallIf you want play a great local multiplayer and single player cheap game,choose this,you will probably not wrong.
Games deserves a 8/10

Key given by the developer to review purposes

reviewText:
Despite having a local multiplayer, It doesn't do Super Crate Box any justice.
And this costs money.

Try Super Crate Box instead.
It's free: Super Crate Box on Steam
Or on their website: http://www.supercratebox.com/

EDIT:
Dead6hot lacks a progression system.
Dead6hot lacks a high score counter.
Dead6hot is slower paced.

It's not bad that the dev has put in time/effort into making this game.
However, people give a bit much praise for it. There are many multiplayer fighting games that offer a better experience than Dead6hot, such as Duck Game and Super Smash Bros.

reviewText:
Part of the unspoken agreement that comes with getting a free game is that you'll play it, review it, and take the time to make thoughtful recommendations to the developer for improvements.

HOWEVER, this agreement becomes null and void when the player realizes that this isn't actually a GAME, but is a self-study project undertaken by a beginner programmer trying to learn the basics of the craft.

It is on that basis that I say: Don't pay a dollar, don't pay a nickel, don't pay a penny, don't even try this for free.

STAY AWAY

reviewText: A cheap game that is not even worth the sale price of 16 cents. There is no exit option in the game.  The steam trading cards are worth four gems and six cents each. If you purchase the game you and then sell the steam trading cards, there is a two cent net profit. Might as well go outside and find two pennies on the sidewalk or around your couch. reviewText:
I did not expect much from a game that is only around 15 MB in size. Except, I wish dead6hot could have been better than this. The idea for this game is good. I like fast-paced shooting games, except this game is not fast-paced at all. The enemies take a long time to kill. The weapons don‚Äôt act the way they do like in any other game. For example, the pistol works exactly like a machine gun and the shotgun does as much damage as a pistol. Lastly, the game gets repetitive after 5 minutes of gameplay.

The versus mode for the game is local only and from what I can tell, it is supposed to justify the bad controls. Whenever I play the versus mode for the game, the match goes on forever. The only way to win is to make sure the opponent never gets a first-aid kit. If they do, it will prolong the match. That isn‚Äôt a good way to decide who wins or loses.

Aside from the gameplay mechanics, the music is just chiptune garbage that loops every 10 seconds. The graphics look like it is trying way too hard to capture the theme of ‚Äúretro‚Äù when it really just comes off as bland. With a forgettable game that will not let you quit, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend Dead6hot nor its prequel Dead5hot to anyone.

reviewText:
THE GAME IS MISSING THE EXECUTABLE AND REQUIRES YOU TO RENAME IT!!! For most people, rename Deadshot022916.exe to Deadshot122115.exe. For Mac users, rename to Deadshot020516. The developer has not done anything to try and fix this so the rest of the review can be disregarded unless you get the game to actually play.

I recently purchased this game at the time of writing (8th February 2016) in the Lunar New Year Sale. I have not played very much (evident by my playtime) but have a basic grasp on the gameplay and how the game works, enough to write a review of decent length.

I bought this game on an impulse buy seeing how cheap it was. I only briefly glanced at the reviews, they were mostly short and there wasn't much to go on. I aim to correct that. Dead6hot is a retro-styled 2D platformer mixed with fighter and shooter elements. I do enjoy platformers, fighters and games with a retro art direction, but this will not add bias to my review.

Gameplay:
The gameplay is fairly simple. There are two modes, Singleplayer and Multiplayer. At the time of writing, I have not tried Multiplayer, as there is no online mode and I have no one to play with at this moment. Multiplayer is local multiplayer, not requiring an internet connection on your device to play. Multiplayer and Singleplayer both include the Versus mode, which is a generic fight between two characters. There are 5 stages to pick from, all with varying layouts. On top of this, there are 10 different characters, ranging from a clown to a minotaur. In Versus Mode, it is a 1v1 match, where both characters have 3 lives.

The character you use can run left and right, and also can jump, but doesn't have a mid-air double jump. Your character starts off with a pistol and a special (as far as I can tell this changes depending on which character you use). However every weapon in this game does have an ammunition limit. It is impossible to leave the stage, as going off the sides will bring you out it's opposite (the left side with bring you out on the right side, and the bottom will make you fall from the top, and vice versa). Item crates appear occasionally on stages, allowing you to get a new weapon to swap your current one with or to refill the ammo of the weapon in use. The controls for Player 1 use the arrow keys to control your movement, the L key to fire your weapon and the O key to use your special. As far as I am aware, these cannot be changed. Each character can only use 3 specials at one time. Health packs also spawn on the stages, allowing you to completely refill the health bar, which is located in the top corners of the screen. CPU ability levels can also be changed, from Timid, then onto Split, then Aggro.

The other mode that is found is simply called Singleplayer or Co-Op. The name changes depending whether you are playing in Singleplayer or Multiplayer. You pick a stage and character as normal, but when the game begins, it is more of a platforming side. You are fighting multiple enemies. One is a small slime, which spanws the most frequently, while the other is a floating eye, which is taller. The CPU enemies do not have weapons for themselves, and can only hurt your character by touching them. If your character falls on top of an enemy, you will still take damage. You are tasked with surviving as long as possible and killing as many enemies as possible too. There is no timer for any of the modes in Dead6hot

Pros:
- A good selection of different character designs.
- Great art direction and style for the game.
- Enjoyable and not frustrating for the user to play.
- Set at a good price.

Cons/Improvements To Be Made:
- Characters are no different in abilities and movement. It would be good to differenciate between each character and not make the different choices purely astethic.
- Weapon and stage choices are limited. It would be amazing if you could improve the roster of both.
- Health packs are very overpowered. They need to be reduced in the amount they can heal, or matches can become almost impossible to win and will last forever.
- There isn't a button to exit the game as of yet. That is a feature that needs to be implemented; the only way to exit the game right now is to press Alt+Enter and close the game.
- There is no online multiplayer. It would be a great addition and is almost required for a game of this style to thrive. If it is implemented, it will appeal to people who don't have others to play with.

Glitches Found:
- This has been confirmed as a glitch but was kept in because the game wasn't meant to be very serious. When I have been playing Singleplayer mode, I have found that jumping on top of an enemy can send you at least twice as high as normal jumping. I can't tell whether it is due to the damage system or simply a glitch due to collision boxes or maybe even something completely different.

Extra Points To Note:
- It feels like the controls for the stage and character selection are backwards. This may be a deliberate design choice, but the movement doesn't seem right to me.

Conclusion:
Overall, I enjoy this game. The creators have done a great job in capturing the feel of a retro game with the art style and soundtrack. The gameplay features are working and strong. There are quite a few things that can be improved, but the developers (Ridhwann Patel, Chuck Obrien and Tanner Daniels, as well as collaboration with New Reality Games) have a very good work-in-progress Steam game on their hands that I will play for hours as new updates come out. I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys platformers, fighting games, shooter games and retro-styled games.

I will be updating this review when new updates come and if I find something new with the game.

reviewText:
I'm not sure what I expected when I picked this game up on sale, but it really wasn't the original Mario with airsoft guns.

Could not play enough to tell if jumping on the heads of red slime or walking eyeballs damages them or was killing me but I at least understand the pun in the name now'; you can't kill a single enemy in under 6 shots it seems. Even point blank with a shotgun.

I will say the controls and maps are good at least. There isn't really a way for me to want to play this game. If I wanted to play Mario I would, if I liked this game my review would be different and I doubt there'd really be an interesting way possible to balance the guns without making them overpowered and just as stupid of a game.

For the makers I'd say you did a good job but on a poor idea, I'm not sure it's even an orginal idea.
